data.title: Not very diverse
data.text: They did not have a very diverse menu. I expected more from a place that claims to represent three countries. The ropa vieja was not very good. the tamales were bland and I did not see anything other then fried plantains as a representation of PR.

data.title: Great service, excellent food and a solid selection!
data.text: It's a great place to go if you want something that isn't like everywhere else you've been. The people who work there are also so nice and take care to make sure your meal is excellent. It's a nice family atmosphere.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: Great food! Service was a little bit slow....there was a group on 20 in front of us and the dining room was full. I do not think that they are used to accommodating this many people at lunch.

data.title: ok, but I will try again
data.text: I came about 6 a'clock and no other customers were there. This by no means is a fancy place. It's fairly plain and has that none renovated, this is the way it looked when I moved in look, that so many mom and pop restaurants do.  I only saw what looked like a young kid behind the counter(12?).  I ordered the Ropa Vieja, black beans and rice, which came with plantains.  It was all good, if not to extraordinary.  The price was good for the decent amount of food you get.  I will go back to sample some of their other foods.

data.title: Undiscovered Gem
data.text: Great Cuban and Mexican food. Real home cooked food. Cuban sandwich, tamales and plantains are the best. Service friendly. Place is spotless.

data.title: Amazed so few people know of this place.
data.text: I eat lunch here every so often.  I'm amazed more people don't know of this place.  The Cuban food is quite tasty.  Service is fine, but the meal is what I'm here for.  Never had a bad experience. I think the 3 "countries" are Mexican, American, and Cuban -- but i only eat the Cuban food.  I can get the other stuff anywhere, but who else in Macon has good Cuban food?

data.title: Great Cuban food
data.text: Cuban sandwich beats Columbia (Ybor City). Great ropa vieja. The flan was wonderful. Clean, friendly, sooo coming back!

data.title: The best Sopes
data.text: The owner took the order, very nice. The quality and taste of the food is amazing. The best Sopes ever!. The restaurant has authenctic mexican food.

data.title: Family food
data.text: This  casual restaurant appears to be run by a family.  It is like sitting down for an informal family meal.  The maduros, yucca, and carnitas were amazing.  Just simple, unpretentious and delicious.

data.title: Fresh, fresh, good food.
data.text: When I say fresh, Cuban / Mexican food, this is the place.  Their lunches are to die for.  I particularly love the chicken enchiladas with the best refried beans I've ever had.  The green sauce is wonderful and all meals are prepared fresh.  For value and quality,  this place has it all.  Excellent service is the norm.   I highly recommend 3 Countries.

data.title: Damn fine food!
data.text: Very fresh Hispanic food! The black beans are outstanding! Really good fajitas, too! & the desserts, yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!!!

data.title: Not as Special as Expected
data.text: This restaurant had an excellent rating from 5 reviews, but did not live up to that rating. Food was good, authentic, and plentiful. But the flavors were not strong or special. The Taco Diablo, the special on Wednesday, was the best offering. The burros were huge. Tacos good, but not exceptional. Hot sauce was not very hot, and the chips a bit stale. We did like the local nature of the restaurant, with the Spanish speaking clients, and supporting a local restaurant. It certainly beats Taco Bell!

data.title: Good Hispanic Food!
data.text: The Black beans & rice are sooooooooo good! & they seve some of the best fried plantains in the state! & If you're hungry, DO have the fajitas!!! SOOoooooooooooooo good!!!

data.title: Delicious and different
data.text: Glad a place like this came to Macon. The menu changes every day - this will just encourage me to visit more days of the week! My visit was enriched by culture and flavor. Get excited for the fried plantains.

data.title: Good Hispanic food
data.text:
They have Mexican, Cuban & Honduran foods & they're all Good!
The fajitas are outstanding! & the black beans are out of this world!!! Some pretty tasty flan, too!

data.title: Best Cuban sandwich and Tres Leches Cake in Middle Georgia
data.text:
My Wife is Cuban!!! so I have been forced into Cuban food!!! I lived in Mexico for 7 years so I know Mexican food very well too, this restaurant has Cuban, Mexican and American food under one roof and Good lord it is good!! Their Cuban sandwich is outstanding, one of the best I have degusted and I have done it by the hundreds, but their Medianoche (midnight) sandwich is to die for, its is like a Cuban sandwich on a sweet roll!!! you can't go wrong with it!!!! their carnitas (fried pork meat) was very well seasoned and tender!!! their French fries are freshly cut!!! no preservatives, fried the right way, fresh!! fresh!!! they have a desert there called Tres Leches (cake of three milks) you need to put this one in your bucket list!! on this place!!! I have tried it on other places!! by the thousand!!! but this one has the right moisture of milk, tender and sweet balanced, with a topping merengue tick enough to make you drool on every bite!!! my wife had a Flan (cheese custard) I had a bite and it was impressive its like a cheesecake but more tender, soft, creamy mix of sweetness and very soft flavor of cream cheese on with sugar syrup!! I bet you are drooling right? and just to end the story, I went to the ER to get my sugar check, I think I became diabetic after my visit! lol and yes I have gone back couple of times more!! and I will do all my department meeting there, every month!!!! well its very close to MCCG, where I practice medicine. 

let me tell you about what you need to see and expect when you visit a restaurant 1) when you enter smell the place if it doesn't smell delicious walk away, 2) check the other costumers plates and what they are eating, make sure they are empting their plate that is a good sign that the food is delicious and third 3) make sure you are welcome with a smile and fast service in a restaurant, after all you are paying them to have a culinary experience!!! this place has it all!!! Buen Provecho!!!! (enjoy your meal)
